title: PM faces ‘perfect storm of sh**tery’ with Budget his last chance, pollsters say

title: Nigel Farage blames Bank of England for UK recession as he blasts Andrew Bailey

title: Railways need the best of private and public sector working together to thrive
description: The strategy calls for a new contractual model which switches decision-making from Whitehall to operators, enabling the latter to use their "commercial expertise" to respond to the needs of passengers. This is "the best way" to grow the railway and provide the best value for taxpayers, the organisation claimed.

title: 'Stop talking down Britain!' Labour's Rachel Reeves criticised for recession response
description: Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves said Prime Minister’ Rishi Sunak ’s promise to grow the economy was “in tatters”. She said: “The Prime Minister can no longer credibly claim that his plan is working or that he has turned the corner on more than 14 years of economic decline under the Conservatives that has left Britain worse off.

title: No matter how the Tories try to spin it, this isn’t prosperity
description: It’s the same with tax cuts. Setting aside one’s political feelings about them, the deeper point is that they’re largely fake. Stagnant real wages plus inflation means that we basically have a downward ratchet on income tax thresholds. Every year, thanks to “fiscal drag” people pay more tax on the same real income.

title: London Overground lines to be given new names and colours in major Tube map overhaul
description: Since Transport for London (TfL) took control of the network in 2007, London Overground lines have been marked as orange on maps. Since then, the network has considerably grown leading to what some passengers describe as a "mass of orange spaghetti" on maps, making it challenging to figure out which train they need.

title: Recession could be last straw for voters as Tories face general election wipeout
description: Critics have lashed out over the 'Rishi recession' announced this morning - just hours after a mega-poll showed the Tories could be left with just 80 MPs after the election
